log_service.log module

log_service.log.add_log()[source]

Add a new log message.

Parameters:

message (str) – The log message to be added

Raises:

werkzeug.exceptions.HTTPException – 400 for bad request, 500 for server errors

Returns:

JSON representation of the newly created log

Return type:

flask.Response

log_service.log.get_logs()[source]

Retrieve all logs.

Raises:

werkzeug.exceptions.HTTPException – 500 for server errors

Returns:

JSON representation of all logs

Return type:

flask.Response

log_service.models module

class log_service.models.Log(message)[source]

Bases: Model

The Log object represents a log entry in the system.

Parameters:

  • message (str) – The log message

  • timestamp (str) – The timestamp when the log was created (defaults to the current datetime)

Variables:

  • log_id (int) – The unique identifier for the log

  • message (str) – The content of the log message

  • timestamp (str) – The time at which the log entry was created

message
timestamp
class log_service.models.LogSchema(*, only: types.StrSequenceOrSet | None = None, exclude: types.StrSequenceOrSet = (), many: bool = False, context: dict | None = None, load_only: types.StrSequenceOrSet = (), dump_only: types.StrSequenceOrSet = (), partial: bool | types.StrSequenceOrSet | None = None, unknown: str | None = None)[source]

Bases: Schema

The LogSchema object is used for serializing and deserializing log data.

Variables:

Meta.fields (tuple) – The fields included in the schema (‘log_id’, ‘message’, ‘timestamp’)
